episodes.title: Happy Trails
episodes.summary: Florence Williams discusses “The Nature Fix,” and Jennifer Szalai talks about new Argentine fiction.

episodes.title: The History of Race and Racism in America
episodes.summary: Ibram X. Kendi discusses the history of books about race and racism in America; Bill Schutt talks about "Cannibalism: A Perfectly Natural History."

episodes.title: Neil Gaiman's Myths
episodes.summary: Neil Gaiman discusses "Norse Mythology"; Sarah Lyall talks about Ali Smith's "Autumn"; and Nick Bilton on two new books about Silicon Valley.

episodes.title: George Saunders on Lincoln and Lost Souls
episodes.summary: George Saunders talks about “Lincoln in the Bardo”; Alan Burdick on “Why Times Flies”; and Maria Russo discusses Laura Ingalls Wilder and the “Little House” books.

episodes.title: A Brave Look at Depression
episodes.summary: Daphne Merkin talks about “This Close to Happy,” and Min Jin Lee discusses her new novel, “Pachinko.”

episodes.title: From Brooklyn to the Gulag
episodes.summary: Sana Krasikov talks about her debut novel, "The Patriots"; and Michael Sims discusses "Arthur and Sherlock: Conan Doyle and the Creation of Holmes."

episodes.title: Barack Obama's Legacy
episodes.summary: Jonathan Chait talks about "Audacity: How Barack Obama Defied His Critics and Created a Legacy That Will Prevail," and Randall Fuller discusses "The Book That Changed America: How Darwin’s Theory of Evolution Ignited a Nation."

episodes.title: Edward Snowden: Hero, Traitor or Spy?
episodes.summary: Nicholas Lemann talks about Edward Jay Epstein's "How America Lost Its Secrets: Edward Snowden, the Man and the Theft," and James Ryerson discusses new books about how to be civil in an uncivil world.

episodes.title: Should You Stop Eating Sugar?
episodes.summary: Gary Taubes discusses "The Case Against Sugar," and Anthony Gottlieb talks about a new biography of Casanova.

episodes.title: How Octopuses Are Like Aliens
episodes.summary: Peter Godfrey-Smith discusses “Other Minds,” and Jeff Howe talks about “Whiplash: How to Survive Our Faster Future.”

episodes.title: The Year in Reading
episodes.summary: Editors at the Book Review discuss what many notable people were reading in 2016, and Will Schwalbe talks about "Books for Living."

episodes.title: Michael Lewis and Arianna Huffington
episodes.summary: Michael Lewis discusses his new book, "The Undoing Project," and Arianna Huffington talks about "Rest: Why You Get More Done When You Work Less," by Alex Soojung-Kim Pang.

episodes.title: The 10 Best Books of 2016
episodes.summary: Stefan Hertmans talks about "War and Turpentine"; editors at the Book Review talk about the year's best books; and Ian McGuire discusses "The North Water."

episodes.title: 100 Notable Books of 2016
episodes.summary: Editors at the Book Review discuss the year's notable books; Ronald H. Fritze talks about "Egyptomania," and Matthew Schneier on "Vanity Fair's Writers on Writers."

episodes.title: Thomas Friedman on 'Thank You for Being Late'
episodes.summary: Thomas Friedman discusses "Thank You for Being Late," and David France talks about "How to Survive a Plague."

episodes.title: Michael Chabon Talks About 'Moonglow'
episodes.summary: Michael Chabon discusses his new novel, and Blanche Wiesen Cook talks about the third volume in her biography of Eleanor Roosevelt.

episodes.title: War Stories
episodes.summary: Thomas Ricks discusses new books about military history, and Maria Russo talks about the season's best new children's books.

episodes.title: John Grisham on 'The Whistler'
episodes.summary: John Grisham talks about his latest novel, and Ben Macintyre discusses "Rogue Heroes."

episodes.title: Thrillers and True Crime
episodes.summary: Charles Finch talks about the season’s thrillers; and Marilyn Stasio discusses new true-crime books.

episodes.title: Beth Macy’s ‘Truevine’
episodes.summary: Beth Macy talks about “Truevine”; Calvin Trillin and Roz Chast discuss “No Fair! No Fair! And Other Jolly Poems of Childhood”; and Molly Young on “Bridget Jones's Baby.”

episodes.title: The Rise of Hitler
episodes.summary: Adam Kirsch discusses Volker Ullrich's new biography of Hitler; Billy Collins talks about his latest collection of poems; and iO Tillett Wright on his new memoir, "Darling Days."

episodes.title: 'Sing for Your Life'
episodes.summary: Daniel Bergner talks about "Sing for Your Life," and Maria Semple discusses "Today Will Be Different."

episodes.title: American Apartheid
episodes.summary: Patrick Phillips talks about “Blood at the Root”; Ethan Gilsdorf discusses three new books about gaming; and Melissa Clark on the season’s best new cookbooks.

episodes.title: Simon Schama's 'The Face of Britain'
episodes.summary: Simon Schama talks about “The Face of Britain: A History of the Nation Through Its Portraits,” and Robert Gottlieb discusses “Avid Reader.”

episodes.title: Maureen Dowd on Clinton and Trump
episodes.summary: Maureen Dowd talks about “The Year of Voting Dangerously,” and Lauren Collins talks about “When in French.”

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Mark Thompson's 'Enough Said'

episodes.summary: This week, Heather Ann Thompson talks about "Blood in the Water"; Seth Mnookin discusses "Patient H.M."; feedback from readers; and Gregory Cowles and John Williams on what we're reading. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Shakespeare in Love
episodes.summary: This week, Alan Riding discusses two new books about Shakespeare’s women characters and his personal life; Parul Sehgal and John Williams have news from the literary world; Michelle Orange talks about five new essay collections; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Matthew Weiner On the End of ‘Mad Men’
episodes.summary: In a special supplement from The Times’s culture desk, Mr. Weiner, the creator of “Mad Men,” discusses the coming conclusion of the series with Dave Itzkoff, a reporter for The Times.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: The Future of Work
episodes.summary: This week, Barbara Ehrenreich discusses “Rise of the Robots” and “Shadow Work”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Andrew Solomon talks about Oliver Sacks’s new memoir, “On the Move”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘A God in Ruins’
episodes.summary: This week, Tom Perrotta discusses Kate Atkinson’s “A God in Ruins”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Ruth Franklin talks about Shirley Jackson; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Life of Saul Bellow’
episodes.summary: This week, Sam Tanenhaus talks about Zachary Leader’s new biography of Saul Bellow; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Emily Bazelon discusses Jon Krakauer’s “Missoula”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Mass Murder in Norway
episodes.summary: This week, Eric Schlosser discusses Asne Seierstad’s “One of Us”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Meghan O’Rourke talks about Elizabeth Alexander’s “The Light of the World”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Spinster’ and Public Shaming
episodes.summary: This week, Kate Bolick discusses “Spinster”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Jon Ronson talks about “So You’ve Been Publicly Shamed”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Brothers,’ About the Boston Marathon Bombers
episodes.summary: This week, Masha Gessen discusses “The Brothers”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Gretchen Rubin talks about “Better Than Before”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Becoming Steve Jobs’
episodes.summary: This week, Brad Stone talks about “Becoming Steve Jobs”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Amanda Schaffer discusses three new books about neuroscience; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Becoming Steve Jobs’
episodes.summary: This week, “Becoming Steve Jobs” and three new books about neuroscience.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Folded Clock’
episodes.summary: This week, Heidi Julavits discusses “The Folded Clock”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Jeffrey Lieberman talks about “Shrinks”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Folded Clock’
episodes.summary: This week, Heidi Julavits and Jeffrey Lieberman.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Opposite of Spoiled’
episodes.summary: This week, Ron Lieber discusses “The Opposite of Spoiled”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Harris Irfan talks about “Heaven’s Bankers”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘The Last Flight of Poxl West’
episodes.summary: This week, Daniel Torday discusses “The Last Flight of Poxl West”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Frank Bruni talks about Barney Frank’s new memoir; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Erik Larson’s ‘Dead Wake’
episodes.summary: This week, Erik Larson talks about “Dead Wake: The Last Crossing of the Lusitania”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Orlando Patterson discusses two new books by black conservatives, “Please Stop Helping Us” and “Shame”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Elliot Ackerman’s ‘Green on Blue’
episodes.summary: This week, Tom Bissell discusses Elliot Ackerman’s “Green on Blue”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; John Hooper talks about “The Italians”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘H Is for Hawk’
episodes.summary: This week, Vicki Constantine Croke discusses Heather Macdonald’s “H Is for Hawk”; Parul Sehgal has news from the literary world; John Williams talks about Nick Hornby’s “Funny Girl”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: The War on Drugs
episodes.summary: This week, Seth Mnookin discusses Johann Hari’s “Chasing the Scream”; John Williams has news from the publishing world; Ben Yagoda talks about “The B Side”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Love and Lies’
episodes.summary: This week, Adelle Waldman discusses Clancy Martin’s “Love and Lies”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Dana Goldstein talks about Anya Kamenetz’s “The Test”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Guantánamo Diary’
episodes.summary: Mark Danner on “Guantánamo Diary” and David Adam on “The Man Who Couldn’t Stop.”

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Jill Leovy’s ‘Ghettoside’
episodes.summary: This week, Jill Leovy discusses “Ghettoside”; Patton Oswalt talks about his memoir “Silver Screen Fiend”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Anita Shapira discusses “Ben-Gurion: Father of Modern Israel”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘Leaving Before the Rains Come’
episodes.summary: This week, Alexandra Fuller discusses her new memoir, “Leaving Before the Rains Come”; John Williams has news from the publishing world; Lauren Groff talks about Miranda July’s “The First Bad Man”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: ‘America’s Bitter Pill’
episodes.summary: This week, Steven Brill discusses “America’s Bitter Pill”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Heidi Julavits talks about Rachel Cusk’s “Outline”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Charles D’Ambrosio’s ‘Loitering’
episodes.summary: This week, Phillip Lopate discusses Charles D’Ambrosio’s “Loitering”; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Sven Beckert talks about “Empire of Cotton”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Parul Sehgal is the host, filling in for Pamela Paul.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Patrick Modiano’s ‘Suspended Sentences’
episodes.summary: This week, Alan Riding discusses Patrick Modiano’s “Suspended Sentences”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Judith Newman talks about Ruth Goodman’s “How to Be a Victorian”; and best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Disappearing Religions
episodes.summary: This week, Gerard Russell talks about “Heirs to Forgotten Kingdoms”; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Phil Zuckerman discusses “Living the Secular Life”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

episodes.title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: A Rare View of North Korea
episodes.summary: This week, Suki Kim talks about “Without You, There Is No Us”; Parul Sehgal and John Williams have news from the literary world; Meghan Daum discusses “The Unspeakable”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.
